column4: I know you guys do not care, but I keep trying different things out of curiosity,  I am not trying to boot Live CD 8.04 64 to see if I get the same problem with the CD.
I Booted successfully from 8.04 LTS
Ok
There was a failure to boot from live CD.  this will not run 64 bit
Ahhhhhhaaaaaaaa
New computer with 4 gigs of Ram will not run 64 bit
What a piece of Crap
is it 64bit?
Well it was sent to me from manufacturee with 4 gigs of Ram in it.
JDU: let me look up the motherboard
pici: thank you.  Its a Dual core pentium 2.5 Ghx
ghz
does the label on the outside of the box (or on the palm rest) have 64 on it.
I know that is not scientific but they want to advertise the 64ness
it was a barbones kit sent by mistake I do not know that much about it.  Guess I should research it.
Vision man sent me the wrong computer first then they sent me a rebuild of the right computer and never asked for the wrong one back
I am paying them for this one too now.  do not have the correct manifest with the correct print outs cause the manifest on the wrong computer was the correct components with the right computer
thanks baz
ï»¿bazhang: that should be in Bios right?
looks like there is only 3.25 gigs of memory
if you are running 32 bit ubuntu, run    sudo lshw -html > lshw.html && firefox lshw.html &
the resulting html file will tell you the width of the processor
